items.name: Advanced Gunnery Control
items.summary: Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0
items.description:
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0
Download: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/releases

This mod gives you more control over the way weapon groups behave when on autofire. For each weapon group, you can select one or more tags, such as e.g. holding fire when flux > X% or avoiding shields, to customise how that group should behave. Also features basic ship modes (e.g. LowerShields when Flux > 50%) and two ~~badly~~  expertly done GUIs.
Can be added/removed/updated to/from an ongoing campaign.

1.6.0 fixes some minor issues, adds two new tags (Range<N% and ShipTarget) and makes the combat GUI lib usable for mod authors (cf. https://github.com/DesperatePeter/test-combat-gui-lib)

Note for faction/content extension mod authors: Instead of suggested modes/suffixes, you can now list suggested tags for your weapons in modSettings.json. If you had already added weapon modes/suffxies, feel free to leave them in for compatibility  with older versions.  (refer to https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/blob/master/data/config/modSettings.json#L16 for an example). 
For details on how to add tags to enemy ships: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control#assigning-tags-to-enemy-ship-weapons

Please let me know if you encounter any issues or have some feedback!

Thanks in advance and happy gaming/modding!

items.name: ApproLight 1.0.6. (Unofficial Translation)
items.summary:
*Mod by: Originem*
Adds the Appro-Light Council faction, which uses high-tech ships with unique mechanics, as well as a considerable amount of side content mainly accessed via commission.
items.description:
*Mod by: Originem*
Adds the Appro-Light Council faction, which uses high-tech ships with unique mechanics, as well as a considerable amount of side content mainly accessed via commission.
This is an unofficial but permitted-to-post translation of the new content by me - any issues should be directed to me rather than Originem.
What's New (relative to the latest 0.91 version):
```
Most ships and weapons have had their sprites updated.
Numerous balance changes, including complete reworks of some hullmods and ship systems.
Addition of the "Appro-Light Ration Center", where you use "Gilbert Coin" purchased with credits or acquired through missions for Originem to exchange for various items, including Prime parts.
All officers recruited from Appro-Light markets have a chance to be clones, including a special skill for free.
A new intel menu by which you can learn more about Appro-Light's lore and mechanics through various events.
And more... (blame the discord character limit)
```
Download link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UFi2O_fm2MYT9yl37g0G_P8VQOGyJFix/view

**Appro-Light Plus 0.5.4 (Unofficial Translation)**
*Mod by: Originem*
Expansion for the Appro-Light mod. Adds a line of special low-tech "Ancient Secrets" ships to the Appro-Light fleet lineup, special ship variants as reward for doing missions for Truth Originem, and the Knights Arbiter boss faction.
Like the above, this is an unofficial translation, so any issues should be directed to me.
What's New:
```
Like with the main Appro-Light, there have been a large number of sprite updates and balance changes.
2 new Ancient Secrets ships and 1 new weapon, as well as 1 new Appro-Light - Full Spirit ship.
All Primus Arborea ships (barring the Crown) have been removed.
```
UPDATE: AL+ is fixed now

items.name: Arkships
items.summary:
This mod adds "Arkships" in to the Sector. Arkships are custom Stations that by using an Ability can be moved to any Starsystem.
They do not participate in the economy and you can’t build Industries on them, but you can activate and deactivate Compartments which enable Features as you do so.
items.description:
This mod adds "Arkships" in to the Sector. Arkships are custom Stations that by using an Ability can be moved to any Starsystem.
They do not participate in the economy and you can’t build Industries on them, but you can activate and deactivate Compartments which enable Features as you do so.
The Core Component is the Arkship-Storage, allowing you to move an entire Stations Inventory through the sector.
More details can be found on the Forum post.

**Changelog** :

-> Removed the Bar Menu selection from the Arkship, as accepting certain Bar Missions seemed to possibly delete the Arkships inventory.
-> Performance improvements for the Arkship-Call ability.
-> Fixed slightly incorrect descriptions in the compartment menu

**Forum Post**: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25091.0>

items.name: Automated Commands
items.summary:
*Adds hullmods that automatically trigger various orders when certain conditions are achieved*
```
items.description:
*Adds hullmods that automatically trigger various orders when certain conditions are achieved*
```
 * Retreat when the ship is below a certain hull integrity level. (90% or 60% or 30%)
 * Retreat when the ship has exceeded its peak performance time.
 * Retreat when the ship is below a certain CR level. (60% or 40% or 0%)
 * Retreat when the ship has no missile left. (the hullmod can only be added to ships with least one missile weapon equipped)

 * Override the personality for non-officered ships (should work for flagship on auto)
 * Vent when flux above 80%. This does not activate while the ship is manually being piloted by the player
```

items.name: Blackrock Drive Yards
items.summary: [0.9.1a] - Adds the Blackrock Drive Yards Corporation, an unscrupulous corporate faction-state that has isolated itself in the southeast fringe of the Core Worlds.
items.description:
Main features:

This mod includes a massive amount of new ships, weapons and other content, is fully compatible with GraphicsLib with shader maps and other content, and integrated with Nexerelin.

Notes on gameplay:

Blackrock ships have bad to mediocre shields, average armor, good flux stats, excellent mobility, lots of firepower, and mix all weapon types. Every ship has a built-in boost to active flux vent rate, meaning they can easily reset flux if given a breather: something you'll want to be doing often, due to mediocre shields and armor.

Most of the faction's warships are excellent at crushing valuable targets and picking apart slow, but powerful foes. On the other hand, they struggle in fights where they can't find any breathing room for hit-and-run attacks, or against a numerically superior enemy that can flank and surround them. Using the faction's weapons, ships can be built for either high risk/high reward play, or low risk/low reward play. Certain ships break the mold and afford different playstyles.

items.name: Common Radar
items.summary: This mod adds a simple, classically-styled radar to the combat interface.
items.description:
This mod adds a simple radar to the combat user interface.

[size=4][b]Legend:[/b][/size]
[list]
[*][b]Zoom level[/b] is shown as four small white lines perpendicular to the cardinal directions. How close they are to the radar's center depends on the current zoom level. Zoom is controlled with [b]+/-[/b].
[*][b]Ships[/b] are drawn as solid-colored shapes. Phased ships will appear faded on the radar, and your ship's current target will have a white marker drawn around it.
[*][b]Shields[/b] will have their active arcs shown in blue.
[*][b]Missiles[/b] are small colored dots; purple for enemy missiles, dark green for allied ones.
The brightness of the dot varies based on how much damage that missile deals, so an Atropos torpedo (2,000 damage) is much more noticeable than an Annihilator swarm (200 damage each). Missiles that are locked onto the player ship are colored orange. Missiles that have burnt out are considered enemies as they can hit either side at that point.[*][b]Missile lock status[/b] is displayed at the top left of the radar box. If any guided missiles are in view and locked onto the player
ship, an orange missile icon will appear here. The brightness of this icon depends on the most threatening missile currently locked on.[*][b]Asteroids[/b] are small white dots.
[*][b]Objectives[/b] are large hollow diamonds.
[*][b]Retreat areas[/b] are shaded yellow.
[*][b]Map borders[/b] are shown as red lines, with a gray void beyond to show inaccessible areas.
[*][b]Combat readiness[/b] for the player ship is shown as a vertical bar to the right of the radar. Current CR is shown in [b][color=#00ffff]cyan[/color][/b], CR lost in the current battle in [b][color=#0000ff]dark blue[/color][/b], and unobtained CR in [b][color=#404040]dark gray[/color][/b]. The bar will slowly flash if you are currently losing CR and flash
faster as malfunction risk rises. For ships that don't lose CR this bar will be faded to be less obtrusive. If you are playing in campaign, your ship's maximum CR given the current captain and crew is shown as a horizontal white line.[*][b]Battle progress[/b] is shown as a bar along the bottom of the radar. It's based on the fleet points remaining on each side, so the larger the
green portion is, the closer to victory you are. Allied ships are shown as a darker portion of each side's bar. A side's portion of the bar will flash if they are in full retreat. The relative fleet strengths at battle start is shown as a vertical white line so you can quickly tell if you're doing better than your opponent.[/list]

items.name: Console Commands
items.summary: An unofficial developer's console for Starsector.
items.description:
This mod adds a developer's console to Starsector that can be summoned with [b]control+backspace[/b]. This (along with many other settings) can be changed by running the Settings command. Other mods can add their own console commands or override base commands; instructions for adding custom commands can be found in a document in the root of the mod folder.

A list of commands that work in the current game context can be found with "help", or a full list of commands with "help all". Multiple commands can be run by separating them with a semicolon (;), and a new line can be started with shift+enter.

This mod should be compatible with all other mods, and can be added to or removed from a save at any time.

Crew Replacer is a mod library built with one goal in mind: to make it easy and quick to mod in new items to be used in jobs. crew replacer lets multiple modders modify the same tasks, by adding a system that lets a modder add an 'crew'(really any type of commodity) to an 'job'. were said 'job's replace all the instances of crew I could find in code.

but what dose that mean? it means that modders now have a system to to change what is used/required when the one tries to 'salvage' or 'survey' or 'raid'. it also means that modders have a system to add new jobs into the game, then let other modders change what is used/required in said task.
updated to version 0.3.1
```
fixed an simple index bug that i missed then found 5 mins after posting this update on discord. sorry
```
updated to version 0.3
```
fixed some bugs with crewReplacer.
    fixed crewReplacer_Job not selecting crew randomly when they have the same priority.
    fixed crewReplacer_Job displaying crew numbers as floats when they were always integers.
    made some optimizations to crewReplacer_Job.
    did something to crewReplacer_Crew, but i forgot what (sorry).

added an new in development feature called supply demand class, that makes it easier to swap out the supply and demand in an market with other commodities
    -this was an accident, it kinda sorta grew out of control to the point it was useful, and i need to put it somewhere.
    -the idea is to let you edit an industry / all industry's in an market, provided it meet the required conditions without having to replace all of said industries with your own code.
    -dose not run on its own. very mush an work in progress that was to useful (or at least i think so) not to put into an library somewhere.
    -also this was something you could always do, apparently. who knew?```

Gives the opportunity to colonies to grow past size 6, as long as the conditions are met (You need a cryorevival facility, and optionally a cryosleeper in system, configurable in the JSON).

* Restored the growth %, but only when interacting with a market in person.
* Need for same system cryosleeper configurable in the JSON.

items.name: Diable Avionics
items.summary: Claiming ownership over millions of people's possessions might seem like a bold claim, but that is one the Diable Avionics Corporation intends to enforce, with deadly means if necessary.
items.description:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/81PQJJdh.png[/img]


[b]TO: CITIZENS OF SECTOR 7[/b]
[b](And to whom else it may concern)[/b]

[b]PURSUANT TO CLAUSE 9.1.1[/b] [i]of agreement dated[/i] 83.06.01 [i]made between[/i] yourself ([i]as contractee[/i]) [i]and[/i] [b]DOMAIN OF MAN [/b]([i]as the registered owner of SECTOR 7[/i])[i] and these habited systems including but not limited to:[/i] [b]Corvus, Askonia, Arcadia, Eos, Magec, Gneiss, and Valhalla[/b] [i]have been repossessed and any interest therein is determined absolutely.

All inquiries relating to property should be addressed to: [b]Junior Treasury Accountant Cristo [/b]

Any persons entering these systems, attempting to enter or assisting others to enter without the registered owner's permission will be [b]TERMINATED with prejudice.[/b][/i]


[center][url=https://i.imgur.com/970Qpoh.png][img]https://i.imgur.com/970Qpohh.png[/img][/url][/center]


[i][u][size=4]GAMEPLAY[/size][/u][/i]


The Diable Avionics play similarly to Mid-tech: using their superior mobility to choose their engagements and overwhelm isolated targets. The subtility they add is that their ships are generally individually slightly inferior to Vanilla ones, but synergize very well with their wings of Wanzers: mech-like strike-crafts that pack a superior punch but susceptible to enemy fire. To help them carry their missions, most ships tend to saturate the enemy's PD with swarms of micro-missiles.

﻿A typical successful engagement against Diable Avionics fleets generally requires a solid phalanx of anti-fighter weapons to break the initial Wanzer and missile waves and a decisive counter-strike while their carriers are still rebuilding their strike-craft support.


[i][u][size=4]CONTENT SHOWCASE[/size][/u][/i]

[center][spoiler][url=https://i.imgur.com/hX9ZSQH.jpg][img]https://i.imgur.com/hX9ZSQHh.jpg[/img][/url][/spoiler][/center]


Features advanced transforming ships:

[img]http://i.imgur.com/xuaQHch.gif[/img]    [img]http://i.imgur.com/XVMGrtC.gif[/img]    [img]https://i.imgur.com/GG7XXH7.gif[/img]


[i][u][size=4]ALTERNATIVE SKIN MODS[/size][/u][/i]

Customize your fleet using one of [url=https://www.patreon.com/posts/44573931]these alternative skin pack mods.[/url] Only activate one in the launcher along with the main mod, you can swap them as often as you want without issue.

[url=https://imgur.com/a/JIYc9nQ]Here are some resources to easily make your own custom skin![/url] I eagerly await to see what others may come up with for custom paint jobs. I would gladly feature popular skin pack mods in the collection.


[center][size=3][i][u]Bug Tracker and Feedback form[/u][/i]:[/size]
You have some feedback to share and want to make sure I do not miss it? You can use [url=https://forms.gle/YbQ8cYUA5QaJBCYV8]this google form[/url] to leave me a comment.


This mod is quite packed with content. When used with other large mods you may need to allocate additional memory.
Visit the [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=10931.0]Modding troubleshooting guide[/url] on the official forum for guidance, or join the [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=11488.0]Unofficial Discord server[/url].


[b]Credits: [/b]
[i]FlashFrozen[/i] for the original mod and designs.
[i]Tartiflette[/i] for the artworks, animations and scripting
[i]Debido[/i] for the Thunderbolt scripts.


You like the mod? Help to make it better: Donations will be used to commission content I cannot create myself, such as illustrations or music. Additionally, if you would enjoy playing with a custom paint job I also take commissions for a reasonable rate. PM me for more details on the Forum or Discord.

[url=https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=WYWX8DR5WPV8G][img]https://i.imgur.com/bAIZOoi.png[/img][/url] [url=https://www.patreon.com/tartiflette][img]https://i.imgur.com/odD0uZQ.png[/img][/url]

[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=375.0]Made with Trylobot and Deathfly's Ship Editor[/url]
[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13976.0]Made using SafariJohn's Rules Tool[/url][/center][center][url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13976.0][/url][/center]

items.name: Diktat Enhancement
items.summary: Ever felt the Sindrian Diktat was too weak as a faction? Ever wanted to see it actually do anything in Nexerelin games without flopping and dying as soon as another faction remembers it exists?
items.description:
Ever felt the Sindrian Diktat was too weak as a faction? Ever wanted to see it actually do anything in Nexerelin games without flopping and dying as soon as another faction remembers it exists?

Well look no further! This mod considerably buffs up the Sindrian Diktat to somewhere between Tri-Tachyon and PL/Hegemony level of size and power. Unfortunately no ships are added since other mods(SWP, Ludd and Lions) have already added those, however this mod instead gives them a new system and new markets.

Now also giving some love to Tri-Tachyon(maybe a bit too much love).

Now compatible with PAGSM(hopefully).

**Partially save compatible - Won’t crash your game if loaded in the midst of a save, but many features(primarily markets) will not be applied to the existing savegame**

**Requires Nexerelin**

items.name: Fast Engine Rendering
items.summary: Uses modern OpenGL rendering techniques to efficiently render custom engine plumes. The main purpose of this mod is a performance boost, taking advantage of modern GPU horsepower. The increase is found through removing CPU load and transferring it to the GPU, which vanilla starsector does not take advantage tremendously.
items.description:
Uses modern OpenGL rendering techniques to efficiently render custom engine plumes. The main purpose of this mod is a performance boost, taking advantage of modern GPU horsepower. The increase is found through removing CPU load and transferring it to the GPU, which vanilla starsector does not take advantage tremendously.

Requires a GPU that supports OpenGL 3.3

```
v1.1.0
-updated shader code to optimised versions from Jon Micheelsen
-tweaked glow visuals
-fixed bugs with system activated engines for good hopefully
-reload engine data with F8
-fixed bug with force override setting```

Features:
> Replace SHIP (and fighter) engine plumes and glows with a fast instanced renderer. Moderate testing suggests a ~25% increase in performance in large battles with many fighter/ships, your mileage may vary.
> Crisp 😩 👌 and smooth engine visual

Caveats:
> Does not affect missile engines, they will still use vanilla behaviour. Engine colour changing has been implemented for Safety Overrides, Plasma Jets and Plasma Burn, however any other modded effects will not take effect because it is hardcoded, this is not fixable unfortunately.

Note: the only compatible Java 8 are version 271, please check pinned post in <#512356777451323393>

Changelogs :
```
-Disable SystemGC, its unnecessary (JRE7/JRE8)
-Show Error Dialog instead of failing to launch silently (JRE8)
-Now come in three different flavor for Windows, Linux-based Distro, MacOS
```

Ever frustrated why your startup loading times is so awful?, got a high-end PC and want to use more of its memory size and speed?, or optimize your potato laptop to play this game?.. we got you covered with 1/2/3/4/6/8GB VMParam. Brought to you lovingly after a week of testing.

```
Packs Included:
- JRE7 Safe Pack
- JRE8 Safe/Aggresive/Dangerous Pack
- For 1/2/3/4/6/8GB
- G1GC Hide Leak Messages mods
```

Key differences between packs
All share the same trait of having a low latency multi-threaded GC (the janitor you may call it) to reclaim unused memory and make the game smooth. For starter I recommending the Safe pack but if you trust your high end PC to pack a punch do give Dangerous pack a go. As for people who're curious about what this do read the Documentation.txt included on each pack.

Known issues
```
- Due to how the mod works, the game may show "Memory Leak! Campaign Duplicates" over time. This is okay!

- However if one of your mod list does have a memory leak.. this mod may fail to clean extra copies.
```

Fully save compatible! If the game doesn't launch after you replace the `vmparam` and you're using JRE8 pack, make sure the `jre` folder is already swapped with JRE8!

HMI Supervillains 0.0.4: Mini-Beta-Campaign-Layer-Update
items.summary: The Draco Group and the Fang Society are two truly deranged factions that inhabit the south-western part of the sector. Both organisations suffer from an obsession with gene-modding to go above conventional humanity in strength, speed, intelligence - and cruelty.
items.description:
The Draco Group and the Fang Society are two truly deranged factions that inhabit the south-western part of the sector. Both organisations suffer from an obsession with gene-modding to go above conventional humanity in strength, speed, intelligence - and cruelty.

The Draco Group, aristocratic and cold, harvest populations to imbibe their blood in their hedonistic rituals, reaving on high-speed high-tech ships from the system of Prester John. The Fang Society, animalistic and vicious, prey on defenseless peoples to consume, eat and torture, roaming the sector from heavily armoured ships.

While their hatred for the Sector is well know, their loathing for each other is even greater. It is for this reason that their impact on the Sector at large is relatively minor, as they are more content to butcher each other.

*0.0.4 Changes*

-Both Fang and Draco have had their markets beefed up, and their faction stats overhauled.
-Added spicy boss-ish fleets to Phylum and Prestor John systems.
-Added Two MagicBounties, giving you a chance to find and use some truly despicable boats.
-Fiddled with a lot of the stats.
-Lots of tiny little fixes.

*Savegame Compatible, but beyond the MagicBounties you won't see new stuff without a new game*

items.name: Kadur Remnant
items.summary: Adds the Kadur Remnant faction as well as several vanilla-friendly ships, weapons, and new starting options.
items.description:
[b][i]god rest the theocrats, c+00 (est.) - c+196.10.17[/i][/b]

[i]Born from the unlikely alliance of two traditionally opposed colonies who banded together during the Collapse to seize their independence from the Domain of Man; the cult-colonies of the Kadur Theocracy were once a great power in the Persean Sector with their own native shipbuilding industry and a powerful spaceborne navy. But now the theocrats are no more -- murdered along with millions of the Kadur people in a brutal conflict which saw the garden world Oasis, the jewel of the Mirage system, seized by the Hegemony and Kadur itself devastated by a Planet Killer-class virus bomb. Now the Kadur Remnant skulk the fringes of the sector in a captured Domain-era orbital fortress and the derelict wreckage of their once-great fleet, fighting a desperate battle for the continued survival of their people.

The faith shared by all Kadur people is still deeply ingrained in every part of their culture, but where the Theocracy was inflexible and hierarchical, the Remnant is decentralized and fluid. Their shared beliefs have grown less dogmatic; focused more now on the connection between individuals forged through mutual hardship, and less on the divine right to power claimed in years past by their religious leaders. The Kadur people remain staunchly independent isolationists, regarding other factions with at best a wary suspicion born from centuries of mutual distrust, but have begun to make some diplomatic connections with other political players in the sector who are hostile to the Hegemony.[/i]

[b]Features:[/b]
[list]
[*]The Kadur Remnant, a remote isolationist faction of refugees and vengeance-seeking holy warriors
[*]Exerelin and Dynasector compatibility
[*]2 new star systems
[*]New ships and weapons for vanilla factions as well as the Kadur themselves
[*]"ship pack only" mode option to disable the Kadur faction and new star systems; only including the vanilla faction ships/weapons
[/list]
[b]Gameplay information:[/b]
The Kadur Theocracy's fleet doctrine was heavily focused on long-range gunline bombardment, faring best when the enemy is kept at arm's length where the Kadur ships can safely catch shots with their otherwise inefficient shields and return fire with their long-range batteries, backing off to vent flux between volleys. However, since the fall of Kadur itself some warriors of the Kadur Remnant have adopted more aggressive tactics, quickly closing the distance to their enemies and overpowering them with close-range firepower before their weak shields and lack of maneuverability can be exploited.
 
Despite sturdy construction and armor, Kadur vessels don't have the durability to stand in the line of fire, and while their focused drive units provide excellent straight-line speed they [i]certainly[/i] don't have the mobility to get themselves out of trouble. They do excel at chasing down fleeing enemies or dashing in to open a gap in enemy lines -- as long as they're careful not to misjudge their opponent's strength and overextend.

[b]A short guide to playing Kadur ships:[/b]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/1BzXWRi.jpg[/img]

To summarize:
[b]Faction strengths:[/b]
[list]
[*]High speed
[*]High alpha strike damage
[*]Long-ranged weapons
[*]High hull strength and armor
[*]High mass
[*]Good forward-facing firepower
[/list]
[b]Faction weaknesses:[/b]
[list]
[*]Inefficient and front-fixed shields
[*]Poor maneuverability including acceleration and deceleration
[*]No energy weapons
[*]Mediocre point defense
[*]Mostly support missiles
[*]Exposed engines and few rear-facing weapons
[/list]

 -- New commodity, exotic beasts, found exclusively on Neoterra

- Mammoth: Wool patches have been tweaked graphically to clash less with damage and engine flames

items.name: LazyLib
items.summary: LazyLib is a library required by most other Starsector mods.
items.description:
LazyLib is not a regular mod. It doesn't add any ships, weapons or factions. In fact, it doesn't change anything at all in your game! All it does is make writing code for mods easier. It contains methods to deal with otherwise complicated tasks like collision detection and formatted sector messages, among many other things.

Some mods may require LazyLib to run. If you are ever running a mod and get an error along the lines of 'Imported class "org.lazywizard.lazylib.<whatever>" could not be loaded', then this mod is required. Just make sure you have the latest version installed and that it is tagged in the launcher and everything should work.

[b][size=4]Installation Instructions[/size][/b]

This is installed the same way as a normal mod. Simply extract the zip into your mods folder and tag it in the launcher. As this mod does nothing until its classes are called, there is no harm in leaving it tagged in the launcher at all times even if your currently active mods don't require it.

items.name: Legacy of Arkgneisis
items.summary: Adds the Anarakis Reparations Society, a duplicitous quasi nation of privateers flying fragile, angular ships designed to avoid fair fights, and capitalize on unfair ones.
items.description:
[center][b][u][size=5]The Anarakis Reparations Society[/size][/u][/b]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/eug9Jdu.png[/img]﻿

If fragmented and incomplete records are to be believed, the Anarakis Reparations Society was originally little more than a band of anti war protesters dating back to the earliest days of mankind's conquest of space. This notion seems almost disingenuous, as the organization that exists today is made up of some of the least trustworthy people to be found anywhere in the Persean Sector. Filling their coffers with pirated goods for some unknown end, most are advised to avoid the ARS. Most also ignore this warning, seeking to take advantage of their lackadaisical attitude toward trade regulation, or to bribe their aggression in a particular direction. In spite of their reputation, or perhaps because of it, they have carved out a niche in Sector politics as a useful tool for more established powers.

[b][size=4]Ships[/size][/b]
The angular ships flown by the Anarakis Reparations Society are designed to keep their enemies at arms length. With only a handful of notable exceptions, their shields are bad, their armor is bad, and their flux wont hold up in an extended firefight. Instead they rely on quick maneuvers and far reaching fire support, afforded by their lightweight hulls and over-engineered weapon mounts respectively. Caught out of position in a face-to-face brawl, many of their hulls will crumble rapidly.
[size=4]
[b]Weapons[/b][/size]
Considering the state of their ships, it is no surprise that the Anarakis Reparations Society favors medium to long range weapons, and thus fields a plethora of unique equipment which falls into this category. Much like their ships, these implements have no traceable design lineage, and schematics for them are overwhelmingly physical with little to no consideration for Autoforge compliance. This forces them to rely on the Sector's more ubiquitous offerings to ensure their fleets are fully equipped.[/center]

items.summary: An utility mod modifying the vanilla beams to better differentiate them.
items.description:
Ever died to a High Intensity Laser beam that looked just like a much tamer Graviton Beam? Ever got all your weapons disabled because the Ion Beam also look like it? Didn't liked that? Well this is a pretty straightforward utility mini-mod that changes the look of all vanilla beams to better differentiate them. They are now color coded for their damage type rather than exclusively for aesthetic choices. They might seem odd at first, but it will make your life in the sector slightly easier.


[img]http://i.imgur.com/vlQ3oVn.jpg[/img]


   If some of the new colors aren't to your tastes, you can go in the mod's data/weapons folder and simply delete the weapons you want to keep unchanged.

items.name: MagicLib
items.summary: This is a small maintenance update, with a few requested addition from other modders. This is a short "pre-release" to make sure everything new works and I did not break anything else.
items.description:
This is a small maintenance update, with a few requested addition from other modders. This is a short "pre-release" to make sure everything new works and I did not break anything else.

```
 - Added MagicAsteroid plugins to restore functionalities related to asteroids that have been removed in the vanilla game (by SafaryJohn)
     
 - MagicIncompatibleHullmod: now handles hullmods with scripted incompatibilities that have been S-modded by removing the incompatible hullmod added instead of itself. (Thanks to Timid)
     
 - MagicCampaign: CreateFleet now handles fleets that have a spawn location but no assignment target.
     
 - MagicBounty: Hopefuly fixed the log spam after a bounty expired.
```
The goal of MagicLib is to create an Open Source, community driven "library" of useful (and well documented) scripts and plugins that can be leveraged and contributed to by every modder.

Check the Wiki for all the details: <https://starsector.fandom.com/wiki/MagicLib>

items.name: MagicLib
items.summary: The goal of MagicLib is to create an Open Source, community driven "library" of useful (and well documented) scripts and plugins that can be leveraged and contributed to by every modder.
items.description:
[url=http://starsector.wikia.com/wiki/MagicLib]The functions are fully documented here.[/url]

[url=https://bitbucket.org/CodingTartiflette/magiclib]And you can contribute to the public repository here.[/url]

[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13718]Link to the forum Thread to report issues or suggest additions.[/url]
[size=4]
[/size][size=5][b]Curent content:[/b][/size]

[u][size=4][b]Functions
[/b][/size][/u]
    [b]MagicSettings[/b]
Offers classes to load merged settings and lists from a shared modSettings.json file. Intended to make cross-mod integration and compatibility much easier to manage.

    [b]MagicIncompatibleHullmod[/b]
A uniform solution for the "incompatible hullmod" issue with vanilla hullmods.

    [b]MagicInterference[/b]
Adds a cross-mod mechanic to balance very powerful weapons.

    [b]MagicAnim[/b]
A collection of functions to make smooth animations.

    [b]MagicFakeBeam[/b]
Creates convincing punctual beams from arbitrary coordinates.

    [b]MagicLensFlare[/b]
Creates "cinematic" lens flares.

    [b]MagicRender[/b]
Draw arbitrary sprites on-screen with constraints to entities/camera when needed. (aka "SpriteRenderManager")

    [b]MagicTargeting[/b]
Allows "smart" target selection for systems and missiles within distance and search cone parameters, plus it can use ship-class preferences.

    [b]MagicTrails[/b]
Allows to create missile-style trails anywhere, from ships to bullets, with a lot of customization options. Also includes a CSV based manager
that should be able to handle most projectile use cases with negligible overhead.

    [b]MagicUI[/b]
Draws UI elements such as a system-like charge-bar/tick box next to the normal ship-system for special systems, or an extra status bar above the flux/hull bars.

[u][size=4][b]Loose scripts[/b][/size][/u]
[i]Scripts that can be used "as it is" or can be copied to individual mods to personalize the result.[/i]

    [b]MagicVectorThruster[/b]
Manages vectoring or vernier-style attitude thrusters.

    [b]MagicMissileAI[/b]
A very customizable and lightweight missile AI script usable without any java knowledge.

    [b]MagicGuidedProjectileScript[/b]
A weapon script that allows regular projectiles to track their target.

items.name: Out of Place Characters - Portrait Conversion
Outer Rim Alliance
items.summary: "We help the poor, lift the desperate, mend the broken, and together, we build a better future."
items.description:
[center]﻿[img]http://i.imgur.com/3F2EkQB.jpg[/img][/center]


﻿[i]Welcome to the Outer Rim Alliance, a growing force of good in these dire times. One of the few groups, if not the only one, able to reverse the spiral of destruction that plagued our Sector since the Great Collapse. Let go of your worldly possessions, give them to the Alliance and we will give you a purpose. Become an agent of reconstruction rather than destruction, and strive to build a better world, together.[/i]


[center][youtube]Kwdl-jQkyTs[/youtube][/center]


[i][u][size=4]GAMEPLAY[/size][/u][/i]


﻿This is a high-tech faction almost entirely composed of broadside ships. As high tech ships, they mostly rely on energy weapons with a few missiles sprinkled here and there. They favor deliberate tactics, using their numerous weapon emplacements to pumel their enemies with long range artillery fire. Slow by nature, they usually rely on dense formations of cruisers with heavy fighter support to keep the enemy at range. While not the flashiest, those ships are reliable and dependable.

On the campaign layer, the Outer Rim Alliance occupy a large cluster of systems with a solid industrial base and a rich history to explore.


[i][u][size=4]CONTENT SHOWCASE[/size][/u][/i]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/8gFduzj.png[/img]

items.name: Rebalanced Doom
items.summary: A minimod that changes the Doom to be less oppressive while maintaining its identity.
items.description:
A minimod that changes the Doom to be less oppressive while maintaining its identity.

Active changes:
- Removes the ability to deploy mines while phasing.
- Reduces the range of the mine strike system from 1500 to 800.

Goal of the mod:
- Make the Doom less annoying to play against and less overpowered to play as.
- Make it harder and riskier to use well.
- Keep its core identity as a backstabbing ship intact.
- Make sure that the AI is able to use the changed ship well.
- Do it with as few changes as possible.

Forum thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21607.0

items.description:
-Thank you Citizen Joe, for reminding me that slipstreams exist.

*Hyperspace is a vital tool to us, a means of communication and transport. Without it, there would be no Domain of Man, for there would be no quick bridges between the stars. We use it, and we harness it, but we have no absolute control over it. It is a wild thing that tolerates our presence, but brooks no mastery. There is power in hyperspace, fundamental power, not good, nor evil, but elemental and anathema to us. It is a tool we use at our own risk.*

items.name: Scy
items.summary: Blood-thirsty pirates for some, ruthless slavers for others, treacherous spies for the rest... The Sector is a tough place to live in, and like many others the Scyan people have been forced to compromise their principles in order to survive.
items.description:
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/gNzbvcT.jpg[/img][/center]


﻿[i]The Scy Nation literally emerged from the ashes of the ""Science Colony of Yggdrasill"". Before the Collapse, the S.C.o.Y. was a nomadic colony built inside an asteroid to travel the stars and study the universe one system at a time. When the Great Collapse occurred and the gate system shutdown the colony became trapped in the Sector, its inhabitants found themselves at the unfortunate center of attention of the Tri-Tachyon Corporation, the Hegemony and the Luddic Church, all eager to get their hands on Yggdrasill's mini-autofactory and its intact pre-collapse UAC library. Using the gigantic ship as a Cryo-arch, two thirds of the population would escape the crossfire while the rest were put to the stake by Ludd fanatics for worshipping the "demonic autofactory".

﻿They tried to rebuild their life in a remote system, away from the core worlds Collapse, but circomstances always seems to pull them back, always forcing them[/i][i] to take further extremes measures to ensure their survival.
[/i]


[center][youtube]0-ooC-pgCFI[/youtube][/center]


﻿This faction mixes all techs in a melting pot of advanced engineering craziness, producing ships and weapons unlike any others. It features ships with modular armor, teleporting guns, phase missiles, laser torpedoes, all sorts of miniguns and more.


[i][u][size=4]GAMEPLAY[/size][/u][/i]


﻿Skirmisher to the core, Scyan ships have a [i]deep[/i] flux pool to make the most out of an hit-run, and slightly better speed to manage to disengage. On the other hand they have slightly more fragile hulls, narrow shields, terrible flux dissipation (relying on venting instead) and fewer weapon mounts. They have to rely on wolf pack tactics to kill isolated targets while the bigger enemies are tied up pursuing smaller prey. Their weapons usually have worse range than vanilla one but superior damage, making even the smallest ship a potential threat if left completely unchecked. When pursued however, they can fold very quickly due to their exposed sides and low staying power.


[i][u][size=4]CONTENT SHOWCASE[/size][/u][/i]

[spoiler][img]https://i.imgur.com/d8SRBYG.jpg[/img][/spoiler]

[spoiler][img]https://i.imgur.com/zY39I6F.jpg[/img][/spoiler]

[center][size=3][i][u]Bug Tracker and Feedback form[/u][/i]:[/size]
You have some feedback to share and want to make sure I do not miss it? You can use [url=https://forms.gle/YbQ8cYUA5QaJBCYV8]this google form[/url] to leave me a comment.


This mod is quite packed with content. When used with other large mods you may need to allocate additional memory.
Visit the [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=10931.0]Modding troubleshooting guide[/url] on the official forum for guidance, or join the [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=11488.0]Unofficial Discord server[/url].


Big thanks to all the modders that helped to create this mod:
[i]Cycerin, Debido, Mesotronik, Dark Revenant, Silentstormpt,
Histidine, SniZupGun, Deathfly, 19_30, and many others.[/i]

Music by [url=https://soundcloud.com/fastland][u]Cycerin[/u][/url]


You like the mod? Help to make it better: Donations will be used to commission content I cannot create myself, such as illustrations or
music. Additionally, if you would enjoy playing with a custom paint job I
also take commissions for a reasonable rate. PM me for more details on

items.description:
Makes very simple tweaks to some skills that my addled brain came up with. Part QoL, part 'immersion', part nerf. Any undesired changes to a skill can be reverted at any time by deleting the relevant .skill file in Simple Skill Tweaks>data>characters>skills. **Please see the readme.txt inside for the exact changes** and inane reasoning.

Hope you get some use out of this, and feel free to @ me if you have any ideas or suggestions. Just be aware I’m probably far too green to be able to implement good ones in any reasonable timeframe.

Thanks to everyone on the discord for knowing things, thanks to <#824910699415207937> for being so generally helpful, and thanks to Histidine for indirectly putting me on to just how easy it is to fiddle with .skill files.

***For 0.95.1***
SBTM: 
> Changes how Tech-Mining loot is generated to remove trash drops like fuel and supplies and replace them with the equivalent value in other items. Also adds a depletion tracker to the industry's tooltip, and improves on the story point upgrade.
> Safe to add midgame (although will require rebuilding any Tech-Mining industries), however unfortunately not safe to remove.

*Changelog:*
- Fixed bug where decay tracker only showed 0% (parenthesis are important)
- Fixed bug where in some situations decay would continue to apply even when industry was improved
- Fixed bug where improvement text wouldn't account for cycle/set setting
- Adjusted settings for a more reasonable experience

Yunru Industries also updated, but only with the above changes.

Those hullmods change the way you use your ships and give them unique abilities
More information on added content can be found on the Forum Thread. 

__Changes & Additions__
-Vampirisms Visual effects have been slightly improved
-Several changes to the secret system (changed primary star, market doesnt require an active transponder anymore, changed descriptions)

__Balance__
-Vampirism now applies its health over time, instead of instantly. Unused Health (i.e if the ship gets to max health) now gets stored and will heal the ship when it suffers future damage

__Fixes__

items.summary: A federation of refugees fleeing from the atrocities of the Outer Rim, the Brighton Federation is a desperate and small polity. Its population waxes and wanes with each atrocity and each acceptance of refugees from the Core, with only the truly most stubborn fools remaining behind.
items.description:
A federation of refugees fleeing from the atrocities of the Outer Rim, the Brighton Federation is a desperate and small polity. Its population waxes and wanes with each atrocity and each acceptance of refugees from the Core, with only the truly most stubborn fools remaining behind.

Due to their desperate circumstances, and a lack of a proper manufactory, the Federation has been forced to utilise whatever they can lay their hands on to use as ships. Consequently, the Federation uses reconstructed Derelict and Remnant ships, or ships reconstructed from derelicts, as their fleet vessels.

items.name: Truly Automated Ships v1.2.2
items.summary: This mod intends to change the way AI officers assigned to automated ships affect the rest of your fleet.
items.description:
This mod intends to change the way AI officers assigned to automated ships affect the rest of your fleet.

This mod makes it more viable to have powerful automated fleets. It's possible, for example, to have up to three Radiants in your fleet without suffering any CR maluses. The drawback is an increase in the amount monthly supplies required to keep your ships operational. You'll really have to think about how much increasing the power of a given ship is worth to you.

This mod applies a reduction to the "automated ship points" of any ship outfitted with an AI officer, depenging on the type of core.
Having an AI core as an officer also causes a hefty increase to its monthly supply cost, reflecting the huge amount of resources required to run an AI core in the first place.

Please let me know what you think of the numbers. I'm open to tinkering with them to find out which values feel the best to play with.

v1.2.2 changelog
```
- Fixed NullPointer error when loading the game
- (Hopefully) fixed negative ship weight bug
```

items.summary:
It allows you, the player, to have 1 portrait that you and only you can choose. The player faction can't pick it, the NPCs cannot as well. You can replace the portrait with anything else to override it. Keep the name, resolution, and format the same. Meant to be prescribed to players who just want a unique player portrait to themselves. If you want to change the gender look inside the player.faction file. Right now it is defaulted to a male gender. There are instructions on wanting a unique female player portrait within the player.faction file. Burn bright, starfarer!
*Can I add more?*

items.name: [0.95.1a] Starfighter Intrastellar Modification Program (SIMP) - 0.99F
items.summary: Nobody saw that.
items.description:
Nobody saw that.

Not save compatible with ***any*** previous versions of the mod.

Foreword:
So as far as I'm concerned, this mod is now finished. I needed to remove the mod's modularity because hidden modular hardpoints kept breaking other people's mods. As a result, removing the loadout flexibility was a necessary step, as the weapon sprites covered all of the actual ship. It was a necessary step for functionality, but with my own level of skill, I wouldn't be able to preserve my original vision for the mod by doing any decoration weapon wizardry.

So it was a lot of fun, and I don't regret my time spent on this little endeavour, but this is the final update for SIMP, barring any catastrophic issues that need immediate resolution.

The tl;dr:
-Requires Arma Armatura and its dependencies to work.
-Adds six strikecraft and five fighters.
-Safe to add, can't verify whether safe to remove.

Changes this patch:
-All ships have built-in, pre-selected weapon loadouts now.
-All ships now generate no weapon flux.
-Flux values drastically reduced to accommodate for weapons no longer creating flux. Flux values are for shields only, now.

Changes last patch:
-Brought DP costs slightly back up, and increased wing OP costs as well. Even after the rework, they're still way stronger than vanilla fighters, and those values should reflect that. 

Credits/Shoutouts:
-Shoi for designing ARMAA and making this project possible in the first place.
-CenturionChet for inspiring me to go down this rabbithole  by making his own mod first.
-Tibby for thinking my kitbashed sprites are cute.
-Amazigh for advising me about kitbashing's viability when I was initially struggling with spriting.
-Doogydong for advice on balance revolving around the Raphus.
-Lavoroxan for more advice around balancing the mod in general!
-Quartofel for doling out advice as well.
-Anyone else whose usernames I can't recall off the top of my head, who helped me with my many, many questions.
-And the entire community. Thank you.

items.name: 🌸 Yunru's Midline Ships Mod 🌸
items.summary: Adds one Firegate, three Destroyers, two Cruisers, one Capital, and one Super-Capital:
items.description:
Adds one Firegate, three Destroyers, two Cruisers, one Capital, and one Super-Capital:
> The Hornet is a small Frigate focused solely on deploying strike craft to the battlefield. It contains a singular fighter bay and a Targetting Uplink.
> The Dart is a light Destroyer, focusing on defenses over offensive capabilities.
> The Corkscrew Destroyer is a missile boat, using vertically aligned missile hardpoints to bring the equivalent of roughly 9 small missile weapons and 1.5 medium missile weapons to bear. Additionally, its Fast Missile Racks allows it to deploy a large amount of ordinance in a short time.
> The Saint, in contrast to the Corkscrew, is a Destroyer with much less numerous armaments, possessing only two large missile hardpoints, two medium ballistic turret mounts, and four small ballistic turret mounts. However with it's limited Missile Autoforge system, it is capable of providing support indefinitely for all but the longest of combats.
> The Armadillo Cruiser, like the Dart, favours durability over offense. While said to be undergunned by most, they serve as a decent distraction, being not quite undergunned enough to ignore.
> The Collumbus Cruiser is the little brother to the Conquest, possessing much the same armaments, but in lesser number and on a lighter, faster frame.
> The Ptero Capital Ship is built around a singular concept: Missile saturation. It's already formidable loadout of four medium missile hardpoints and one large missile hardpoint is further augmented by an unrestricted Missile Autoforge system.
> The Spear of Persea is designed to pierce enemy battle lines, the Spear is capable of effectively engaging with both broadsides simultaneously.

***Changelog:***
> Added the Saint-class Destroyer.
> Reworked the Spear of Persea to make it more Midline.
> Made the Spear of Persea's quests more accessible.

*Available at: https://www.patreon.com/posts/mod-links-60097706*

items.name: 🌸 Yunru's Misc Ships Mod 2.5.9 (MSM for short) - Burnout Update 🌸
items.summary: A collection of ships that don't yet have a place to call home.
items.description:
A collection of ships that don't yet have a place to call home.
> The Zeus-class Artillery Frigate, a mobile bombardment platform capable of mounting a single large energy weapon. While slow and weakly armoured, it does possess a basic shield, and a Phase Skinner for both defense and mobility.
> The Sphyrnidae-class Cruiser focuses on close-range brawling. A combination of a Flux Shunt and Unstable Containment Fields lets the Sphyrnidae excel despite the normal weaknesses associated with a shield-focused ship at close quarters.

> The Steve-class frieghter is a more armoured version of the Buffalo, designed for a more hostile sector. A Burn Drive and Damper Field allows it to escape pursuit when needed, while a shielded cargo hold helps avert attacks in the first place.
> The Tiwaz-class Capital is the little brother to the Onslaught. While it lacks the signature Thermal Pulse Cannons, it possesses a higher level of integration than most ships in existence.
> The Offensive-class Onslaught, in contrast, is a bigger, beefier Onslaught. Much of its bulk is dedicated to its pair of Thermal Pulse Accelerators, allowing it to fire faster and hit harder. It's ship system also received adjustments, being replaced with Manuevering Jets to bring its main weapons on-target quicker.

*Available at: https://www.patreon.com/posts/mod-links-60097706*
